title: removed most of the trading section except for feedback on user profiles
message:
removed most of the trading section except for feedback on user profiles

As per https://www.steamgifts.com/discussion/yWGlf/steamtrades SteamTrades
is essentially handled as separate site. This is noticable by two different things:

- usernames on SteamTrades are not necessarily identical to SteamGifts ones.
  This is mitigated by using the SteamID64 for trade feedback user links.
  Keep in mind trade feedback isn't necessarily feature-complete.
- A lot of HTML class names changed.

Meanwhile, there is no sight of an official API coming ever. And, quite
frankly, with random undocumented website changes (see a1adfe24), this is a
huge pain in the ass.

Contributors are of course welcome to (partially) revert this change to restore
the trade list in a pull request. Issues that are blatantly obvious:

- You need to login separately on SteamTrades, which may not even need to be
  the same user (you *might* violate the SteamTrades Terms of Services in that
  case, but I haven't read them)
- Deleted comments are not handled.
- HTML/CSS class names are entirely different for the trades, comments, etc.
  from SteamGifts.
- User profiles on SteamGifts may not exist for a SteamTrades user.
- Replies to negative reviews are not checked and may only be displayed by
  pure chance. I've never seen a reply.
- "Safety" information such as VAC or game bans, user registration, last login,
  steam level, game count and SteamID/*32/*64 are not displayed.
- Your own steam trades are shown by visiting the site
  https://www.steamtrades.com/trades/search?user=yoursteamid64
  but you can't directly fetch the SteamID64 from SteamGifts, thus proving
  an annoyance in building the navigation.

Your milage may vary, but for a feature I've never used I can't justify the
effort for myself. Packing both "fixing SteamTrades comments on profiles"
and "deleting the rest of SteamTrades" may be an unfortunately big comment,
but that's how it is.

(cherry picked from commit a5bf22bffad37b379571387d1f7fdb40f08c9e16)

title: updated time calculation to site standards (fixes #37)
message:
updated time calculation to site standards (fixes #37)

SteamGifts has changed the format in which time values are given in HTML:
Instead of having an attribute 'title' with the corresponding timestamp in the
HTML itself, this attribute is now calculated based on the attribute
'data-timestamp'.

This means its no longer really relevant to parse the time out ourselves,
requiring changes to CustomDateTime

Additionally, the format for 'Begins in ...' for future giveaways has been
altered slightly so the 'Begins in' text is no longer in the <span/>

(cherry picked from commit a1adfe249ff09aec0de910e252aaab287b9d60c1)

title: removed travis-ci build files
message:
removed travis-ci build files

Building with Travis was, historically speaking, as much of a gamble you could
imagine. Builds would randomly fail, while f-droid would always manage to
build them without an issue. Restarting failed builds manually, however, always
seemed to "fix" the issues encountered before.

As such, the build status indicator by travis-ci is highly unreliable and does
not actually indicate whether or not the current build is broken. As a rule of
thumb, however, all commits on the 'master' and 'stable' branches should always
compile.

title: change Version Code variation to apply to all builds not containing '.beta-'
message:
change Version Code variation to apply to all builds not containing '.beta-'

This effectively is only applicable if your upgrade path looks like x.y-beta.z -> x.y while using chocolate as main flavor, which is only applicable/recommended to developers. Otherwise, installing 1.2 over 1.2-beta.1 would be a 'downgrade'.

Non-developers are unaffected by this, as beta and stable versions are not using the same package name; and stable versions were always using a higher version code.

title: Merge branch 'polls'
message:
Merge branch 'polls'

Viewing the discussion list indicates if the discussion has an associated poll.

Viewing a single discussion adds three different types of elements under the card view, but above the actual comments:
* a header for the poll to show the actual question
* a list of selectable answers, with the ability to vote for a single one
* a separator saying '-- comments --' before the actual comments

fixes #15

title: swipe to dismiss a message
message:
swipe to dismiss a message

Dismissing a message ensures the message itself and all older messages will no longer be shown in any notification.

Ignoring a message until a new message arrives, without dismissing it, will still stack it into multiple messages.

title: minor adjustments to FAB + ListFragment.
message:
minor adjustments to FAB + ListFragment.

There's still an issue with the ListFragment not properly recreating the FloatingActionButton if the instance is recreated. If we're on a pager with 3+ pages though, it is possible to see the FAB again by swiping to a page that was not the direct neighbor.

title: tweaked scroll-to-top behavior for paged fragments
message:
tweaked scroll-to-top behavior for paged fragments

As of this change, paged fragments have a floating action button to scroll to top. Instead of relying on loadItemsInitially for paged fragments, this value is now determined by whether or not the current fragment is active in the relevant FragmentStatePagerAdapter.

If it is not, the FAB is not changed. If the current fragment is active, we set the click listener to scroll up in the current fragment. Beforehand, a FragmentStatePagerAdapter could have changed the scroll click listener even if it wasn't the active fragment, often appearing as "does nothing".

title: fallback for a rare circumstance in which setUserVisibleHint would be called…
message:
fallback for a rare circumstance in which setUserVisibleHint would be called before onCreateView, which would crash the application.

Since both onCreateView and setUserVisibleHint share the same code to call fetchItem/showNormalListView, we'll just ignore the visible hint call in that case.

title: switched FragmentPagerAdapter for FragmentStatePagerAdapter.
message:
switched FragmentPagerAdapter for FragmentStatePagerAdapter.

This allows us to replace a fragment at runtime, i.e. for transient fragments, without the old fragment being displayed regardless of what the new fragment is.

title: clicking on the notification icons now shows you your notifications while the…
message:
clicking on the notification icons now shows you your notifications while the avatar goes to the profile as before.

The envelope is always shown (without a number) if no notifications of any sort are present.

Text color is now theme-dependent so it's easier readable in the light theme.

title: hide the keyboard when submitting a search query
message: hide the keyboard when submitting a search query

title: EndlessAdapter no longer has any references to the view.
message:
EndlessAdapter no longer has any references to the view.

Instead fragments call view.addOnScrollListener(adapter.getScrollListener()).

This allows us to create an adapter in onCreate() instead of onCreateView() for the ListView, which - in turn - allows us to return to the fragment from a search without reloading everything.

title: Perform actual logout upon clicking logout
message:
Perform actual logout upon clicking logout

Before, the session id and all user data was only wiped locally. Now a
request is sent to .../?logout to ensure the session is properly reset
remotely.
